page.title: 18STOKE ORCHARD STATISTICS
page.content: All references to{marriages, burials {and baptisms}before 1814 at Stoke Orchard are in the registers of St. Michael & All Angels at Bishops Cleeve. Stoke Orchard Church was not licenced for marriages until 1947. Since then there have been 22 couples married there. The earliest references in the{Tredington Registers are:- Burial 1541 Baptism 1549 This date could be earlier but part of the page is torn away. Marriages 1601 It was ordered by Henry VIII in 1538 that registers should be kept in all parishes. The early registers are now kept at the County Record Office in Gloucester. In Tredington Churchyard there are the steps and the slender shaft of a 9 foot,{14th Century Cross.
